Yes, I think it's likely that we will see more traditional companies start to adopt blockchain technology in the future. While the technology is still relatively new and relatively complex to implement, many companies are starting to see the potential benefits of blockchain, such as increased security, transparency, and efficiency.

In the finance industry, for example, many banks are exploring blockchain-based platforms for a variety of use cases, from cross-border payments to trade finance to asset securitization. Even central banks are exploring options for creating their own digital currencies using blockchain technology.

In the supply chain and logistics industry, we're seeing many companies adopt blockchain-based platforms to track products as they move through the supply chain, which can improve visibility and reduce the risk of fraud and counterfeiting. And in the healthcare industry, some companies are exploring the use of blockchain for securely storing and sharing patient data across multiple providers.

Overall, while the adoption of blockchain technology is still in its early stages, it has the potential to transform many industries in the future. As the technology continues to evolve and mature, we're likely to see a growing number of companies exploring how it can be used to improve their processes and operations.
